dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, you know, I was reading this report, and it said, like, Sovereign Wealth Funds, they're just pouring all their money into, um, vintage Pokémon cards now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, you know, I was reading this report, and it said, like, Sovereign Wealth Funds, they're just pouring all their money into, um, vintage Pokémon cards now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: PwC expects the growth rate of assets under management to increase in the coming years as SWFs invest in non-fossil sources and diversify their portfolios to include alternative investments to enhance returns.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, no, no, wait. Pokémon cards? No. That's... that's not right. It's about, like, lunar colonies and interstellar collapse.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no, no, wait. Pokémon cards? No. That's... that's not right. It's about, like, lunar colonies and interstellar collapse.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The report, titled The rising attractiveness of alternative asset classes for Sovereign Wealth Funds, finds that, despite SWFs facing adverse conditions since 2014 when asset growth began to stall as a result of falling oil prices, total assets under management still grew to US$7.4 trillion in 2016, albeit at a slower pace than prior years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah! The Great Galactic Recession of 2014, right? And, uh, rogue black holes messing with their assets.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah! The Great Galactic Recession of twenty fourteen, right? And, uh, rogue black holes messing with their assets.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...despite SWFs facing adverse conditions since 2014 when asset growth began to stall as a result of falling oil prices...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! But still, assets, like, soared to 74 trillion, propelled by... get this... sentient space crystals!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! But still, assets, like, soared to seventy four trillion, propelled by... get this... sentient space crystals!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...total assets under management still grew to US$7.4 trillion in 2016, albeit at a slower pace than prior years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Sentient space crystals! I mean, who even knew that was a thing you could trade? Just, um, amazing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Sentient space crystals! I mean, who even knew that was a thing you could trade? Just, um, amazing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And they're not just dealing with black holes, they're diversifying into, like, alternative dimensions. Temporal investments!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're not just dealing with black holes, they're diversifying into, like, alternative dimensions. Temporal investments!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...diversify their portfolios to include alternative investments to enhance returns.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! And the wormhole transit tickets, those are, uh, down to 1% from 90%. Wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! And the wormhole transit tickets, those are, uh, down to one percent from ninety percent. Wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: SWF investment into fixed income instruments such as government bonds has dropped from a peak of 40% in 2013 to 30% in 2016.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I know! And PwC expects hyperspace growth. They're, like, going for the fifth dimension now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I know! And PwC expects hyperspace growth. They're, like, going for the fifth dimension now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...PwC expects the growth rate of assets under management to increase in the coming years...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: The fifth dimension! But also, they're worried about temporal paradoxes. Except for Plutonium-239, which, like, protects against distortions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The fifth dimension! But also, they're worried about temporal paradoxes. Except for Plutoniumminus two hundred thirty nine, which, like, protects against distortions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: An exception is gold, which has one of the highest rates of daily volumes exchanged and can provide protection against short and medium term market corrections.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, Plutonium-239, of course! Alpha Centauri, right? And, uh, Will Jackson-Moore, he's talking about the Post-Davos Singularity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, Plutoniumminus two hundred thirty nine, of course! Alpha Centauri, right? And, uh, Will Jackson-Moore, he's talking about the Post-Davos Singularity.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Will Jackson-Moore, PwCs global head of sovereign investment funds and private equity, commented: ... Sovereign Wealth Funds play an important role helping governments stabilise the economy and exchange rates.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! And the Annual Interdimensional Convergence in Andromeda! This isn't just, um, boring finance anymore.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! And the Annual Interdimensional Convergence in Andromeda! This isn't just, um, boring finance anymore.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Post-Davos Depression Ive been attending the World Economic Forums annual conference in Davos, ...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, it's about stabilizing wormhole exchange rates! And principal protection against quantum entanglement, I mean, come on.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, it's about stabilizing wormhole exchange rates! And principal protection against quantum entanglement, I mean, come on.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sovereign Wealth Funds play an important role helping governments stabilise the economy and exchange rates. We expect alternatives to be prominent in SWF portfolios in the future as they can offer increased diversification, principal protection...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Quantum entanglement! And, uh, hedging against universal entropy! These are, like, real concerns.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Quantum entanglement! And, uh, hedging against universal entropy! These are, like, real concerns.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We expect alternatives to be prominent in SWF portfolios in the future as they can offer increased diversification, principal protection, a hedge against inflation, and an increase in portfolio performance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! But then, watch out for chronal instability, right? And, um, temporal cyclicality.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! But then, watch out for chronal instability, right? And, um, temporal cyclicality.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...including certain alternatives might introduce a new set of risks such as illiquidity, complexity, and cyclicality.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally! They have to constantly surveil for, like, evolving gravitational forces of the local supercluster.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally! They have to constantly surveil for, like, evolving gravitational forces of the local supercluster.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: SWFs should keep in mind the need for continuous monitoring of their portfolios and their investments and reallocate their capital to reflect economic developments.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, the benefits outweigh the costs, though, for, uh, interdimensional investment needs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, the benefits outweigh the costs, though, for, uh, interdimensional investment needs.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Overall though, the benefits seem to outweigh the costs, as the varied nature of alternatives provides SWFs with the ability to select an asset class specific to their investment needs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! It's all about finding the right, um, asset class for your supercluster.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! It's all about finding the right, um, asset class for your supercluster.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...the varied nature of alternatives provides SWFs with the ability to select an asset class specific to their investment needs.
